timeline.message:
WIP: Add HttpRoutingDataReader

HttpRoutingDataReader is a component used by new ZkClient APIs to make an HTTP read request to the metadata store directory service to retrieve routing data. ZkClient APIs will construct an internal MetadataStoreRoutingData instance based on the raw routing data retrieved from MSDS.

    * @throws IOException
    */
   private static CloseableHttpResponse getAllRoutingData() throws IOException {

timeline.bodyText:
_parseRoutingData can return an empty map. Then the empty map can be return to user.  This is basically telling user we find nothing. This is error condition.
If we make this method public, we should let user know this error condition by throwing exception.
timeline.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText:
If we find nothing, we should return an empty map. Users should handle it. Helix Java APIs are the users, and they will handle this scenario as well.
In other situations (IOException, invalidRoutingDataExceptions), appropriate exceptions are thrown.

I did not examine the TrieRoutingData implementation. Can we make sure _metaDataStoreRoutingData will not be empty map after this line?
This is important. Otherwise, with empty map, you are not going to retry getRawRoutingData. The result is disaster then.
timeline.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText:
_metaDataStoreRoutingData is not a map. It may have empty content, but if it does have an empty content, the users will fail (basically fail to instantiate).
This RoutingDataReader only reads - and from its perspective, it can read something that's empty. That's valid. Error checking should be done by the user. Separation of responsibility.
replies.author: narendly

replies.bodyText: Better to throw if _metaDataStoreRoutingData upon instantiation successfully still have empty (invalid data). Throw early easy for user to identify the problem.
